context: Could you recommend something from the author Robert Jackson? I've been hearing a lot about him lately.
Sure! Robert Jackson wrote The tragedie of King Richard the second and The Merchant of Venice which are both plays. Have you read either of these?
The Tragadie of King Richard the second sounds interesting. Did Robert Jackson write it or adapt it from Shakespeare?
You got it! The Tragadie of King Richard the second was originally written by William Shakespeare in 1595 and adapted by Robert Jackson.
I would imagine that means it is pretty good then. I think I will check that out, can you add it to my reading list?
Sure! You might also like his book Much Ado About Nothing which is Part of his series, Shakespearean comedy. Have you read it yet?
No, I will check it out. Thanks.
Cool! Much Ado About Nothing was released 1598 and was also made into a play written by Kylie Scott. Have you seen it?
No, but I've been wanting to check out more Shakespeare related work. Have to go now thanks again.
entity: The tragedie of King Richard the second
resp: Great! William Shakespeare also wrote Macbeth which is another great book you might enjoy!
